name: CVE-2021-23239
description: The sudoedit personality of Sudo before 1.9.5 may allow a local unprivileged user to perform arbitrary directory-existence tests by winning a sudo_edit.c race condition in replacing a user-controlled directory by a symlink to an arbitrary path.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sudo_project:sudo:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sudo_project:sudo:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:netapp:cloud_backup:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:netapp:solidfire:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:netapp:hci_management_node:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:32:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:33:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:10.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
